actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to increase the amount of Federal reimbursement to States under the aid to families with dependent children program for the cost of locating and securing support from parents who have deserted or abandoned their children receiving aid under such program, and to provide that the State welfare agencies may utilize the services of private collection agencies and similar organizations and entities in locating such parents and securing support for such children.

summary.text: Increases the amount of Federal reimbursement to States under title IV (Grants to States for Aid and Services to Needy Families With Children) of the Social Security Act for the cost of locating and securing support from parents who have deserted or abandoned their children receiving aid under such program, to 75 percent of the State's expenditures. Provides that the State welfare agencies may utilize the services of private collection agencies and similar organizations and entities in locating such parents and securing support for such children. (Amends 42 U.S.C. 603(a)(3)(A))

titles.title: A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to increase the amount of Federal reimbursement to States under the aid to families with dependent children program for the cost of locating and securing support from parents who have deserted or abandoned their children receiving aid under such program, and to provide that the State welfare agencies may utilize the services of private collection agencies and similar organizations and entities in locating such parents and securing support for such children.
